FuncDef: The display mpls lsp protocol rsvp-te command displays detailed information about a specific or all RSVP-TE CR-LSPs.
CLIs: display mpls lsp protocol rsvp-te { [ outgoing-interface { <out-if-name> | <out-port-type> <out-port-num> } ] | [ nexthop <nexthop> ] | [ incoming-interface { <in-if-name> | <in-port-type> <in-port-num> } ] | [ lsr-role { ingress | egress | transit } ] | [ out-label <out-label> ] | [ in-label <in-label> ] } * [ verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the nexthop address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies an outgoing label value.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 1048575.

Specifies an incoming label value.
The value is an integer and the value ranges from 16 to 65551.

Specifies to display the verbose information.
-

Examples: * means the LSP is detour LSP
FEC                In/Out Label    In/Out IF                      Vrf Name
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view detailed information about a specific or all RSVP-TE CR-LSPs, run the display mpls lsp protocol rsvp-te command. The command output helps diagnose faults.
If no parameter is configured in this command, detailed information about all RSVP-TE CR-LSPs in the Up state is displayed.
